alert.note: Alert for King (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 22 at 6:40PM PDT until June 22 at 8:45PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Loch Katrine burn scar in... Northeastern King County in west central Washington... * Until 845 PM PDT. * At 640 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Loch Katrine Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the burn scar area. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Loch Katrine Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Loch Katrine Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern King County FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Loch Katrine Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
